result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pedro Angel Zarate

defendant.name: Zarate, Pedro Angel
defendant.address: 2109 S Westgrand Lane, West Milwaukee, WI 53219

records.addlTxt: Case recalled at 3:25. Court moves to dismiss COUNT 1 due to lack of probable cause. State does not object. COUNT 1 IS DISMISSED.

Defendant Pedro Angel Zarate not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.

Defendant Pedro Angel Zarate not in court. 
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 11-02-2022.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
